text:
e="preserve">Bridget Rowe (16 March 1950 – 12 January 2021) was a British journalist.
Rowe was an Assistant Editor of "The Sun", then editor of "Sunday", the "News of the Worlds magazine. In 1986, Rowe became editor of "Woman's Own".
Rowe edited the "Sunday Mirror" from 1991 to 1992, then moved to edit "The People". She was a panelist on the first series of "Loose Women" in 1999.
Rowe died on 12 January 2021 from COVID-19 at the age of 70.
